Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: hotel, hotèl, hótel, hôtel, and hoṭél

Translingual

[edit]
Hotel [1]
Hotel [2]
Hotel [3]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • hotel, HOTEL

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English hotel.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [hoˈtɛl][1]

Noun

[edit]

Hotel

  1. (international standards) NATO, ICAO, ITU & IMO radiotelephony clear code (spelling-alphabet name) for the letter H.
  2. (nautical) Signal flag for the letter H.
  3. (time zone) UTC+08:00


ICAO/NATO radiotelephonic clear codes
Alfa Bravo Charlie Delta Echo Foxtrot Golf Hotel India Juliett Kilo Lima Mike
November Oscar Papa Quebec Romeo Sierra Tango Uniform Victor Whiskey Xray Yankee Zulu
zero one two three (tree) four (fower) five (fife) six seven eight nine (niner) hundred thousand decimal

Translations

[edit]
the letter "H" in a national spelling alphabet
  • Bulgarian: Хотел (Hotel)
  • Czech: Helena (cs)
  • English: How
  • Estonian: Harald
  • Finnish: Heikki (fi)
  • Italian: hotel (it)
  • Swedish: Helge (sv)

References

[edit]
  1. ^ DIN 5009:2022-06, Deutsches Institut für Normung, June 2022, page Anhang B: Buchstabiertafel der ICAO („Radiotelephony Spelling Alphabet“)

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French hôtel.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /hoˈtɛl/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɛl

Noun

[edit]

Hotel n (strong, genitive Hotels, plural Hotels)

  1. hotel

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Hotel [neuter, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein das Hotel die Hotels
genitive eines des Hotels der Hotels
dative einem dem Hotel den Hotels
accusative ein das Hotel die Hotels

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Badehotel
  • Billighotel
  • Dreisternehotel
  • Fünfsternehotel
  • Hotelbesitzer
  • Hotelhalle
  • Hotelpage
  • Hotelübernachtung
  • Hotelzimmer
  • Hotelzufahrt
  • Insektenhotel
  • Landhotel
  • Nobelhotel
  • Strandhotel
  • Stundenhotel
  • Viersternehotel

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Hotel” in Duden online
  • “Hotel” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache

Luxembourgish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French hôtel.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈ(h)oːtæl/, /(h)oˈtæl/

Noun

[edit]

Hotel m (plural Hotellen)

  1. hotel

Plautdietsch

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

Hotel n (plural Hotels)

  1. hotel
